newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - April 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - April 7.

text.p: The following is a summary of major stories in leading South Korean newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (822) 727-5650. Fax: (822) 727-5666.
- South Korean government is responding favourably to North Korea's proposal for a briefing to the proposed peace talks.
- Washington is seen changing its "soft-landing" policy towards North Korea to a "hard-landing" policy as the possibility of a collapse looms in the North.
- South Korean finance minister Kang Kyong-shik said at a finance ministers meeting at APEC in the Philippines that South Korea welcomes North Korea into the Asian Development Bank.
- A parliamentary hearing on the Hanbo loan scandal starts on Monday for 25 days. Forty-one people involved in the influence-peddling scandal will be questioned during the live televised session.
